titleInfo.title: Letter No. 40 of 1850 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns slave trade treaties in the Persian Gulf region. A covering letter encloses printed pages from the Bombay Government Gazette (folios 6-8), republishing an Act of Parliament, dated 1 August 1849. The first part of the Act's text is an English translation of an Engagement between Samuel Hennell and Sultan bin Sugger [Sulṭān bin Saqr Āl Qāsimī] Sheikh of Ras-el-khyma [Ra's al-Khaymah], dated 10 December 1847. The Engagement gives British naval and East India Company ships the right to apprehend vessels suspected of transporting slaves, and offers bounties to crews for slaves and cargoes seized.
